pull_request.title: fix: initial state of startup hints visibility checkbox
pull_request.body:
When opening the startup hints using the OpenBoard menu, the checkbox "Visible next time" is always checked. Instead I would expect that it represents the current status of the `EnableStartupHints` setting.

This simple PR sets the checked state of the startup hints visibility checkbox according to the `EnableStartupHints` setting.

I have based my branch on `master`, so that it can be applied to either `dev` or `1.7.1-dev`.

repo.name: OpenBoard
repo.description: I'm using this fork to contribute features and fixes to the upstream project. In order to create good pull requests, I'm rebasing my feature branches, squashing and reordering commits, etc. If you fork this repository be aware that my development branches may rewrite history without prior notice.

repo.name: OpenBoard
repo.description: OpenBoard is a cross-platform interactive whiteboard application intended for use in a classroom setting.

issue.title: Unable to install openboard in ubuntu 23.10
issue.body:
Recently installed ubuntu 23.10, after I tried to install open board 1.7 it shows unmet dependencies, manually installed all files but unable to install these two files libavformat59, libswscale6. can you please rebuild the package for 23.10
Thankyou

comment.body:
The limited font set is intended: To make documents exchangeable between different computers, OpenBoard restricts the font list to some fonts which are installed together with OpenBoard. So every user of OpenBoard sees the same font list, regardless of platform and system fonts. This avoids many problems when exchanging documents. Did you ever use a special font in a Powerpoint (or LibreOffice Impress) presentation, moved the file to another computer and then the slides looked completely different? OpenBoard wants to avoid this experience.

Currently there is no clean way to extend this list. A dirty workaround is to copy additional fonts to the resource directory of OpenBoard. In my builds, this is `/usr/share/openboard/customizations/fonts`. But note: this folder is owned by the installed package. Copying files to this folder requires root permission and is something you normally should not do, as the package can no longer be cleanly uninstalled without deleting these files manually again. So be warned.

What about the welcome screen? I'm always looking for feedback on my builds. Please describe this problem in detail in a [new issue on my fork](https://github.com/letsfindaway/OpenBoard/issues/new/choose).

issue.title: Unable to install openboard in ubuntu 23.10
issue.body:
Recently installed ubuntu 23.10, after I tried to install open board 1.7 it shows unmet dependencies, manually installed all files but unable to install these two files libavformat59, libswscale6. can you please rebuild the package for 23.10
Thankyou

comment.body:
> Instead of building OpenBoard by yourself, you might also either use the Flatpak or try my [experimental builds](https://github.com/letsfindaway/OpenBoard/issues/89). For Ubuntu 23.10 you can find the packages at https://download.opensuse.org/repositories/home:/letsfindaway:/experimental/xUbuntu_23.10/amd64/
> 
> As @kaamui stated above, Ubuntu 23.10 updated `ffmpeg` to a new version and so all the package names related to `ffmpeg` have changed.
> 
> Edit: changing the library name in the package as kaamui explained assumes binary compatibility of the API of both `ffmpeg` versions. I doubt that this can be guaranteed. The package names typically change when the Appilication Binary Interface changes...

THX ... your experimental build is OK except welcome screen :) open board again in use did not tested all functions. I am happy again :)

issue.title: fix: sporadic crash due to dangling connection
issue.body:
During my tests for the issue with the live thumbnails I got some sporadic crashes while zooming. I now could catch two occurrences and I think I can trace them back to dangling connections pointing to deleted objects. See https://github.com/letsfindaway/OpenBoard/issues/147.

Here is my fix:

- connections to a lambda are only automatically deleted if
  - the sender is deleted or
  - a context parameter is given in the connect call before the lambda
- use `clazy` to find all missing context parameters
- add missing context parameter to lambda connections
- note: not all fixed lines are "dangerous"
  - as many fulfill the first condition
  - they are deleted when the sender is deleted

comment.body: Instructions on how to reproduce the problem: https://github.com/letsfindaway/OpenBoard/issues/147#issuecomment-1778590878

issue.title: Context menus on wrong monitor
issue.body: Windows 1.6.4, when using two displays in extended mode, we can swap the control and display screen within the options. But when clicking the openboard main menu or export or anything that would pop up a context menu it still displays on the primary monitor. Is it a setting in the config or something i can fix easily?

comment.body: @kaamui sorry for coming back to this, is qt 6.6.0 okay?

pull_request.title: fix: sporadic crash due to dangling connection
pull_request.body:
During my tests for the issue with the live thumbnails I got some sporadic crashes while zooming. I now could catch two occurrences and I think I can trace them back to dangling connections pointing to deleted objects. See https://github.com/letsfindaway/OpenBoard/issues/147.

Here is my fix:

- connections to a lambda are only automatically deleted if
  - the sender is deleted or
  - a context parameter is given in the connect call before the lambda
- use `clazy` to find all missing context parameters
- add missing context parameter to lambda connections
- note: not all fixed lines are "dangerous"
  - as many fulfill the first condition
  - they are deleted when the sender is deleted

issue.title: Context menus on wrong monitor
issue.body: Windows 1.6.4, when using two displays in extended mode, we can swap the control and display screen within the options. But when clicking the openboard main menu or export or anything that would pop up a context menu it still displays on the primary monitor. Is it a setting in the config or something i can fix easily?

comment.body: Please be aware that we don't compile with Qt 5.15.2 because of another issue where right-clicking on a `QGraphicsItem` (or maybe it's only for `QGraphicsTextItem` I don't remember) would make the app crash.

issue.title: Portable version
issue.body:
Hello everyone. 
It would be really cool to have a portable version of OpenBoard (for example to put on a USB key, for teachers who go from school to school...).
Regards !

comment.body: OK, I hope to see an official portable version someday then :)

issue.title: Portable version
issue.body:
Hello everyone. 
It would be really cool to have a portable version of OpenBoard (for example to put on a USB key, for teachers who go from school to school...).
Regards !

comment.body:
A new version always come with its own config file (potentially with some options removed, some others added). 

I don't want to promote a portable version as it is not cross-platform, and would work with some "hard-coded" configurations that I don't want to encourage, but thank you, and the most important is that you can on your side adapt OpenBoard to your needs.

issue.title: Portable version
issue.body:
Hello everyone. 
It would be really cool to have a portable version of OpenBoard (for example to put on a USB key, for teachers who go from school to school...).
Regards !

comment.body:
A little question for the future though : when you have an update, do you keep the settings in the .config file, or do you reset them to the default values ?
I don't want to create any bugs.

issue.title: Portable version
issue.body:
Hello everyone. 
It would be really cool to have a portable version of OpenBoard (for example to put on a USB key, for teachers who go from school to school...).
Regards !

comment.body:
Cool !
When you release 1.7, I can, if you want, make a portable version using the trick I described, so you can add the "portable" version to the download options.
Because once more, I think that many teachers won't be able to use that on their own.

comment.body:
Don't worry^^

It will probably take a while before I can look at it, or it may not be validated internally, but I intent to add two tabs in the preferences : one listing the changes of each new version, and another one listing all the configurable options.

comment.body:
It seems to work !
If I put DataDirectory=./documents I have an error, BUT
DataDirectory=./library/documents seems to work !
I'll continue to test and keep you updated :)

issue.title: Portable version
issue.body:
Hello everyone. 
It would be really cool to have a portable version of OpenBoard (for example to put on a USB key, for teachers who go from school to school...).
Regards !

comment.body:
> I don't know and can't look at it. Try and let me know.
I'll try and tell you :)

> You answered your question yourself, it would be disastrous for many reasons.
I don't think that anyone is using OpenBoard for multiple users. In most cases, there is one computer in each classroom, and one user (teacher) using it.

issue.title: Portable version
issue.body:
Hello everyone. 
It would be really cool to have a portable version of OpenBoard (for example to put on a USB key, for teachers who go from school to school...).
Regards !

comment.body:
> Alternatively, is it possible to put a relative path for the DataDirectory ? (like ./Documents, so we can just create a "Documents" folder inside the installation folder of Open board).

I don't know and can't look at it. Try and let me know.

> Anyway, is there a particular reason to store the Documents in the user folder by default ? Why not just store it where OpenBoard is installed ? I guess this is to have one document folder per user, but is it really the most use scenario ?

You answered your question yourself, it would be disastrous for many reasons.

issue.title: Portable version
issue.body:
Hello everyone. 
It would be really cool to have a portable version of OpenBoard (for example to put on a USB key, for teachers who go from school to school...).
Regards !

comment.body:
I think that the idea of having a fully portable version of OpenBoard would be a great adding (I download it, I put it on my usb key, I use it).

Alternatively, is it possible to put a relative path for the DataDirectory ? (like ./Documents, so we can just create a "Documents" folder inside the installation folder of Open board).

Anyway, is there a particular reason to store the Documents in the user folder by default ? Why not just store it where OpenBoard is installed ? I guess this is to have one document folder per user, but is it really the most use scenario ?

> Just tell me what you want to have here.

I didn't see this message, sorry. I didn't want to force you to do what I want. You frequently have a better knowledge so I was open to discussion. When it comes to a matter of taste, then OK I'll maybe stick to my preferences, but I'm generally open to discussion.

pull_request.title: Fix glitches when moving items below live thumbnails
pull_request.body:
I think I finally found a solution for the problem with glitches when moving items below a live thumbnail, especially in large zoom factors. See https://github.com/letsfindaway/OpenBoard/issues/143#issuecomment-1771092503. We have to

- disable updates of board while updating thumbnail, and
- ignore the next repaint event on the board induced by re-enabling updates for thumbnail update.

fix: glitches during update of live thumbnail

- disable updates of board while updating thumbnail
- ignore next repaint event on board induced by re-enabling updates
  for thumbnail update
